This quickly became one of my favorite games after i purchased it. It is awesome to play as your favorite killer/suvivors from various franchises. The bad part about this game is the community. Never have i ever played a game where hateful messages were sop common. The survivor side is especially entitled. If you play killer they will get super salty over how you play, especially when they lose. People seem to forget this is just a game, and that its a horror game at that. Survivors survive, and killers kill. My advice to newcomers... facecamp, tunnel, bodyblock and loop away! You paid for the game, play how you want and enjoy the salty players!

Le jeux est malade en tabarnak

[h1]THE SURVIVAL HORROR ELEMENT[/h1]

The game is essentially “hide and seek with murder” and while the coat of paint over it is a horror theme, there are very few times outside of playing against Michael Myers who is one of the tougher Killers or from a few Hag Trap jump scares, that you will actually tense up, that is not to say the game isn’t thrilling to play, because in the best of times it is extremely thrilling. The game features a ton of Killers and Survivors from various horror movies, TV shows, and video games, as well as original characters made by Behaviour Interactive.

[h1]PLAYING KILLER[/h1]

I started out playing the game as a Killer main, mostly in 2018 and 2019, and the had game peaked by the end of 2018 honestly. If a 4 vs 1 ratio wasn’t bad enough, Behaviour Interactive gave into the cries of Survivors by buffing/nerfing the gameplay and perks to where the game is now primarily Survivor sided, so I tend to lean more towards Survivor these days. 

If you don’t enjoy getting hate mail, then avoid playing Killer. It doesn’t matter if you camp or don’t camp, if you do not let a Survivor win then prepare for the strong possibility of hate mail, so just play however you want as long as it’s fun for you. I developed quite the palette for Survivor tears over the years, and I now welcome the hate mail.

My Killer Mains: Leather Face before his rework was my PB n J, I also used to really love The Pig before her nerf, The Legion is fun for when I want to get sweaty and a lot of Blood Points, and The Wraith (Bing Bong Boi) and The Trapper are timeless classics. 

Leather Face (Original) > Pig > Trapper > Wraith > Legion 

[h1]PLAYING SURVIVOR[/h1]

Having fun playing Survivor really comes down to how skilled you and your teammates are, you will need at least 2 (can include yourself) average to above average skilled Survivors to succeed I’ve found. Repairing Gens (Generators) should always be your number 1 priority right up until one of your teammates is knocked down, then you or another one of your teammates should try to rescue them. 4 vs 1 is EZ mode, 3 vs 1 is EZ mode, but when it drops down to 2 vs 1 is when things start to get challenging, so rescue those hooked teammates. Sneaking around, escaping chases, dropping pallets, and some harmless tea bagging all make for a good time. 

My Survivor Mains: Meg Thomas with her three red braids will forever be irreplaceable as my main and in my heart. Heather Mason (Cheryl Mason), Kate Denson, and Yui Kimura are all a close second.

Meg > Heather > Kate > Yui > Bill > Nea > Ash >>> Everyone Else.

[h1]RANK[/h1]

Rank doesn’t really matter to be honest. Rank 16 - Rank 20 players are all of the people who are new to the game and in that case they will naturally be terrible. However Rank 1 - Rank 15 players all play the same, the closer to Rank 1 they are, the more sweaty they will be, that is all. Nea Karlsson, David King, and Quentin Smith are for whatever reason usually chosen by the sweatiest of edge lords, so keep an eye out.

[h1]GAME UPDATES[/h1]

The addition of new Killers, Survivors, Perks, Maps, and Cosmetics are always welcome and keep the game fresh. However with the exception of End Game Collapse (which puts a timer on the game once the exit gates are open, so the Survivor can’t hold the game hostage) I feel like the game peaked around late 2018 gameplay wise. The game seems to break a little bit more with each buff/nerf.

[h1]OVERALL THOUGHTS[/h1]

I find that people who play Dead By Daylight fall into 1 of 2 categories. 

Category 1: Tried out the game for a weekend with friends, and never touched it again.

Category 2: Tried out the game and now has a crippling addiction to it, so that they always come back to it, even after taking several months off at a time.

If you can find a way to play a version of the game from 2018 then I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game, in it's current state.......I've got to give it a hard pass fam.

Kind of on the fence about this game, I'd say it's good every couple months for a match or two with friends, but it just doesn't hold interest long enough.  Still pretty decent, so worth a buy if you have friends to run with.

Вы будете играть только против чуваков с 100-200 часов (а то и все 500), которые уже прокачены, знают карты  и всё умеют. Матч мейкинг полная параша, не берите этот кал, если вы хотите в одного поиграть за убийцу, просто испортите себе настроение. 
 НО! НО! - спустя часов 5 вы поймете принципы этой помойки и начнёте делать минус 2-3 даже против челов с 500 часов. Так что - брать или нет, даже хз. Но такого экспириенса, как игра за маньяка, никто другой на рынке пока предложить не может. Был бы ещё донат более добрым - было бы точно да. А так - бешенные бабки на скины и на маньяков тратить надо.
